articles.title: U.S. Smear Campaign against DPRK Assailed
DPRK Stamp Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
U.S. Smear Campaign against DPRK Assailed 
    Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Reunification Solidarity of south Korea released a commentary on March 2 in denunciation of the U.S. smear campaign against the DPRK.
 The commentary recalled that the U.S. State Department asserted in an "international narcotics control and strategy report" on March 1 that there exist the substantial evidences showing the involvement of the DPRK in drug and other illegal dealings.
 The U.S. labeled the north of Korea as a "criminal state" and has exerted sanctions upon it, the commentary noted, charging that all those acts are prompted by its intention to isolate and stifle the north.    
 The whole world recognizes that the U.S. is the biggest producer and market of drugs and a country where a largest number of counterfeit notes overflow, the commentary said.    
 The commentary urged the U.S. not to resort to its far-fetched allegation in a bid to conquer other countries but to be aware of its crimes and strive to redress them.
 It demanded the U.S. repeal all the base reports pursuant to the hostile policy towards the north.

DPRK Stamp Exhibition Opens 
    Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- A Korean stamp exhibition is now going on to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the publication of the first stamp of the DPRK.
 Displayed at the exhibition opened on March 9 are over 4,500 kinds of stamps issued reflecting the proud annals of the Korean revolution after the first DPRK stamp "Samson Rock" was released on March 12, Juche 35 (1946) under the meticulous care of President Kim Il Sung.    
 Looking round the stamps carrying portraits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk, the visitors are retrospecting on the brilliant revolutionary life and undying feats of the peerlessly great persons.
 Attracting the eyes of the visitors are the Korean stamps collected and displayed at the exhibition in chronological and thematic order by philatelists across the country.

Joint Military Exercises Announced in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean military warlike forces announced that they would launch large-scale joint military exercises RSOI and Foal Eagle from March 25 to 31, according to the south Korean KBS.
 They have planned to involve 20,000 U.S. troops including those stationed overseas and huge forces of the south Korean army in the military exercises aimed at rapid mobility of U.S. reinforcements into south Korea and commitment and deployment of the aggression forces in case of "emergency" in the Korean Peninsula. It was said that a powerful task force consisting of U.S. aircraft carrier Kitty Hawk, a cruiser, destroyer, nuclear-powered submarine and supply ship would be committed to the exercises.
 Moreover, they have schemed to hurl Striker armored cars into the exercises as they did last year.    
 Their announcement of adventurous nuclear war exercises against the north is evoking deep concern and indignation at home and abroad as it is a vicious challenge to the desire of all the Korean people for peace and reunification.

Negotiations for "Free Trade Agreement" Assailed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 12 (KCNA) -- Public organizations in south Korea on March 6 protested against the decision to push ahead with the negotiations for the signing of the "Free Trade Agreement", which was made at the first preliminary meeting for the negotiations between the United States and the south Korean authorities, according to south Korean KBS.
 The emergency measure committee of agricultural, stockbreeding and fishing industries called a press conference in front of the building of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and charged that the "government" and conservative media are misleading the public opinion, asserting the FTA would serve as a "motive force for economic growth", though agriculture will sustain greatest damage from the FTA if it is signed.    
 The preparatory committee for the All-People Measure Committee to Defend Screen Quota and Check the U.S.-south Korea Free Trade Agreement, too, held a press conference at which it denounced the "government" for its humiliating moves to persistently push forward the negotiations without public consensus.
 The Measure Committee of Moviemen to Check the Cultural Aggression and Defend Screen Quota declared that it would stage an all-night sit-in strike at the Citizens Park in Kwanghwamun, Seoul, from March 6 in order to maintain the screen quota without fail.

Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Somawansa Amarasinghe, leader of the People's Liberation Front of Sri Lanka.
 It was conveyed to DPRK Ambassador to Sri Lanka Han Chang On by the leader of the PLFSL on Mar. 2.
 He said that the PLFSL unequivocally supports the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their struggle to achieve the reunification of Korea.

articles.title: U.S. Presses S. Korea to Increase Fund for Upkeep of U.S. Troops in S. Korea
DPRK's Stance on Nuclear Disarmament Clarified
articles.content:
U.S. Presses S. Korea to Increase Fund for Upkeep of U.S. Troops in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- The commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea at a "hearing on the defense budget" held at the U.S. Senate Armed Services Committee cried out for pressurizing south Korea to increase the fund for the upkeep of the U.S. troops present there, sparking public furor, according to the south Korean MBC on March 7.
 He blustered that how the south Korean side approaches the issue of the share of the fund for the upkeep of the U.S. troops there is a clear barometer showing whether it wants and respects their presence in south Korea or not. Explaining the plan to bolster up the south Korean forces, he disclosed that the construction project of a wharf capable of hosting a nuclear-powered carrier is also included in the plan for the construction project of a base for the 3rd fleet of the south Korean navy expected to be completed by the end of June this year.    
 The south Korean MBC commented that what the commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea uttered was nothing but a strong pressure upon the south Korean authorities to increase the fund for the upkeep of the U.S. troops.

S. Korean Women's Gathering for Settlement of Issue of "Comfort Women"
    Pyongyang, March 11 (KCNA) -- Women of south Korean civic and public organizations including victims of the "comfort women" for the Japanese army reportedly held the 699th Wednesday meeting in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul on March 8.
 At the meeting speakers said that the issue of the "comfort women" for the Japanese army has not yet been resolved owing to the Japanese authorities' evasion of their responsibility though generations have changed. They accused the south Korean "government" of taking no measure for its settlement.    
 They said that the reality in which a lawmaker remains unpunished even after his sexual abuse convinces them that they have nothing to expect from the authorities and should settle the issue by themselves. They called upon the women to take the lead in the struggle to settle the issue of the "comfort women" for the Japanese army.
